Name: The Last Knight
Description:
In Egla Town, you hear legends of the "Night Reveries" and a "Mad Knight." You decide to investigate these stories.

<color=highlight>Hidden rewards can be found in this area.</color>
QuestDesc:
In Egla Town, you hear legends of the "Night Reveries" and a "Mad Knight." You decide to investigate these stories.

<color=highlight>Hidden rewards can be found in this area.</color>

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With humility, justice, and bravery... I vow never to use force against women, children, or the defenseless. I will stand against injustice until my last breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's that, Mr. Cosimo? I didn't miss a word. Can we start the knighting ceremony now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you recited it perfectly, but... I'm no longer part of the Order. What you have before you now is only a simple innkeeper. I'm afraid... I've no right to knight you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do have some old friends still in the Order. If you can wait a bit longer I can...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No right? I can't wait any longer! Every time we get this far, Mr. Cosimo, you always come up with one excuse after the other to delay the ceremony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch your words, Carlow! Accusations like that betray everything you just swore to uphold. And to say such things in front of an outlander?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... forgive me. But... Mr. Cosimo, tell me the truth. You don't really believe I saw a knight when I was a child, do you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The young man politely bids you goodbye and leaves in silence...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Tacet Discord... To its credit, that's not a bad knight impression.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's all that about? Is it challenging us to a duel?
In the name of Korlacchi...
"Across the rivers of time, wherever my path may lead, I vow to uphold justice and fairness for all..."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That voice just now... Did you hear that, Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And also... What was that in the end...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: TDs usually mumble the stuff they're trying to say. It might've learned it from somewhere, or maybe the frequencies it absorbed had strong emotions and desires.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the name of Korlacchi... seems like something a knight might say before charging into battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't wait to see the townsfolk's faces when they find out the legendary Mad Knight is actually a TD.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's ask Cosimo about those mumblings in the morning. He might know a thing or two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure thing. Come to think of it, I feel like we're being pretty knightly ourselves right now, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Abby, and the great knight {PlayerName}, two heroes who solved a legendary mystery with humility, justice, and bravery... Heh, a knighting ceremony would make it even cooler.

Options.PlotLineKey: Titles don't hold much value for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Abby wait until the morning and decide to ask Cosimo about the mumblings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, outlander. You're up rather early in the hour, aren't you? What can I do for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's about a knight, Mr. Cosimo. Have you ever heard an oath that goes like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the name of Korlacchi, I pledge to show mercy and kindness to the weak. Across the rivers of time, wherever my path may lead, I vow to uphold justice and fairness for all..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You observe Cosimo closely as Abby delivers its spot-on impression of the Mad Knight. The slight dilation of his pupil gives away the answer you need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, there's a line missing. In the name of Korlacchi, I will remain true to all that I love and protect until my last breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where did you learn those words? Was it from Carlow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlow? No, no, we only met him yesterday. It's from the night...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's from... it's from a knight who loves the night. He was the one who told us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This knight you speak of. Where did you meet him? Is he still around town?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So, Carlow really did meet a knight. It's just like the day he came dashing over to me, reciting those same words you did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought he read those in a book. But he insisted that he heard it from a knight passing by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had a feeling that Korlacchi might be a family name and that the knight's oath reflected his path of service, so I asked Carlow about the knight's livery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlow described how the knight dismounted from a weathered warhorse, clad in silver armor. He removed his helmet and laid his hands on Carlow's head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then he pulled a ring from his pocket and told Carlow he would continue his journey into the depths of Whisperwind Haven, seeking distant horizons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He asked if Carlow wanted to be a knight and gave him this ring as a keepsake, telling Carlow to rewalk his path one day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To reach the end where he had arrived, and then... to journey even further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this ring is made from coarse steel. Nothing like what Carlow described.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I had my doubts about Carlow's tale. I thought he'd gotten lost in those knightly stories and made it all up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He... At this hour, I imagine he's roaming the outskirts of town, searching for the knight's trails.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He intends to find the knight and the family he serves to complete the knighting ceremony in Korlacchi's name and finally become a true knight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a large tree not far from town, where he said he found the first trail. Do you plan to go after him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think you can catch up with that knight? If you can, please help the poor boy find the knighthood he's been dreaming about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That tree... I remember you can see it from the highest point in town. That may be your best bet. I'll leave Carlow to you, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! I knew it be strong, but not that strong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does this mean it really is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey... {PlayerName}, Abby...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... We finally caught up with you. You move too fast. What happened just now... Was it another TD?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, that's right. But {PlayerName} and I took care of it with the old one-two. No biggie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, aren't you two sharp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, they sure are... Huh? Mr. Millkeeper... did you just say something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Are you both warriors drawn here by the knight's legend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haven't seen such fools in a long time. Watching you two charge in like that... exactly like the ones that came before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean there were others? I don't think I've ever seen any besides you, Mr. Millkeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course there were. Some choose to move on, and some... well, they just aged out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The so-called Windmill Keepers in today's language. But back in the day, I... We were called knights too—though more accurately, we were considered fake knights who excelled at deception.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were outcasts, people in distress, and many ordinary folks who were drawn in by the legend. We'd find an old horse and cobble together some makeshift armor, and fashion a sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We clung to our notions of the knight's oath, laughingstocks wherever we went, dreaming of exploring Whisperwind Haven and even venturing beyond its limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends of knighthood continued to spread, but over time, the knights in these stories grew more noble and refined with every retelling...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the people of Egla Town finally realized that there were newcomers settling in Whisperwind Haven, the nameless knights had already become the Windmill Keepers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: S-So what you're saying is… the Windmill Keepers weren't protecting the Windmills. They were watching over... Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't till we arrived that we realized the many dangers lurking throughout the land. Moving forward wasn't as simple as we thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then a knight tossed a ring made of rough steel onto the table and said briskly, "Let's carve out a path ahead."

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Soon enough, others will follow and reach the same place we have..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My younger self wouldn't dare believe words spoken so lightly. A new path meant risking everything, even our lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That knight might have noticed my hesitation. He came over to talk to me and recited his oath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the name of Korlacchi, I hold fast to humility and justice... Across the rivers of time, wherever my path may lead, I vow to uphold justice and fairness for all..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was right. This was the path we all swore to... and he stuck to it until the very end, right here in Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-But how were you so sure that more people would come? What if...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... Remember the ring? We were knights skilled in deception, so why not make it all one grand performance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He would travel far and wide with those rings, and in the name of Korlacchi, preach the knightly way to anyone who dared dream of becoming one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regardless of wealth, title, or position...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So who was he?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Funny you ask. Despite his vigor, he was just an ordinary farmer from the countryside...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An ordinary farmer... A knight of deceit... Korlacchi. Never really existed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlow runs away in a hurry. As Mr. Millkeeper looks confused by Carlow's outburst, you explain that Carlow has been chasing after the knight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see. That must be a bitter pill for the boy to swallow. All this time chasing after a dream only to find out it was an illusion all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wasn't where he lost the knight's trail. It's where his journey ended.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People love to romanticize the past, don't they? The knight in shining armor we saw as children was really just an ordinary farmer in tattered rags riding a frail old horse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, apologize to him for me. We are liars, nothing more. But... once he's cooled off, he will come to understand. He's been seeking what we once sought, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone who made it here left their marks. The trails they walked, the words they spoke, the tales of the ones who explored the furthest reaches of Whisperwind Haven...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These things shine brighter than any life and are more genuine than any knightly title.

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you... ever felt lonely on this path?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, perhaps this path of chivalry we uphold is always meant to be walked alone. Besides, "he" is always there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must have met him, right? The Echo that you used in the battle just now was displaying his sword skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean the Mad Knight?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mad Knight? So that's what the townsfolk call him. Not bad... At least he's got a title now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "He" appeared around the same time as the Windmill Keepers. There's no doubt "he" is a Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the swordsmanship, the way he speaks, and his stance against other TDs all remind me of him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People say that TDs can absorb lingering frequencies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe he exists because the essence of knighthood has taken root deep in Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He swings his sword against enemies to protect the things he loves. When he points his sword at the common folk he meets, I think he's challenging them to a duel... He hopes someone will accept his challenge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He is showing that to be a true knight, one must abandon uncertainty, confront fears, and wield their sword with courage.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you tell me your name, and the others?
I'd like your name to remember you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Names... Hmm, no one's asked that before. What's wrong with using a common title?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I know. {PlayerName} is great at picking names. Come on, do your magic!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nameless... Windmill...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the wind, it leaves a trail that's difficult to trace, yet it journeys to distant lands...

Dialogues.Speaker: Whisperwind Knight
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whisperwind Knight...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just a bit further and we'll reach Windmill Lodge. That's where all traces of the knight vanish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must have overlooked something! This time, I swear I'll find what I'm looking for!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's get going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Millkeeper, it's been some time. You seem to be in a good mood today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me introduce my guests from a foreign land. They also had the pleasure of encountering the knight...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mr. Millkeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, {PlayerName}, Mr. Millkeeper doesn't mean to be unfriendly. He's been acting like that from the day I knew him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's not much of a talker, but he always laid out tea and snacks for me during my search for the knight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never mentioned his name. Seeing that he lives right here, I began to call him Mr. Millkeeper considering the townsfolk call people like him Windmill Keepers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't say for certain. Stories about them vary. Some say Windmill Keepers are a mysterious part of Egla Town's history tasked with maintaining the Windmills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's also said that the Windmill Keepers are outcasts—people who have nowhere else to go after returning from the sea. They choose to make their homes in the abandoned windmills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whichever the case, their presence never disrupts the peace in Whisperwind Haven. I doubt anyone would want to be the troublemaker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Abby? You... What's the matter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, that's a familiar smell...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. Where are you going? {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do we have here? Our little pretend knight isn't out chasing footprints today. Just standing there like he's lost his spark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, have you received the invitation? We're just about to buy the attire for the ceremony. Why don't you join us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not every day you get to have a "real" knight be as your guide, after all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Calm Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on. We've wasted enough time here already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey... Those are the two we met earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forget it. You may as well be a rock if you've nothing to say. Off we go on...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...(Breathes deeply.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the name of Korlacchi, I pledge to show mercy and kindness to the weak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will remain true to all that I love and protect until my last breath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Across the rivers of time, wherever my path may lead, I vow to uphold justice and fairness for all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arrogant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's got into you? Reciting your little fantasy knight's oath now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right here, I, Carlow, swear to the knight's code and challenge you to a duel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know which part of the fish is the best? Can you practice your sword skills with just a simple wooden pole? Do you know the best path deeper into Whisperwind Haven...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you ever truly helped someone without expecting anything in return, or charged toward a giant with no thought for yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This duel... it all comes down to an apology. The loser must apologize to the victor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, check it out. I think Carlow's got that wannabe tough guy acting all scared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? What if Carlow gets bullied...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let knights handle their own matters. In the name of Korlacchi...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what does Korlacchi mean anyhow?

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone needs to visit the library more often.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? No way. Not happening. Reading makes me nauseous. Just tell me the answer already!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Korlacchi, in the Rinascita language, means courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're thinking that knight-guy's Overclocked, huh? I don't know, but one thing's for sure I'm picking up a bunch of familiar smells all over this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, it's not far now. The Echoes are getting ready for their opening act, all set to welcome the star of the night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why's he just sitting here like a statue? Hey, Carlow! Can ya hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, there's something strange about this floating Echo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I was just... stunned. Back at the camp, I started to see the resemblance of the knight in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like the knights of legends, you charged forward... with humility, honor, and bravery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you're different from the knights I've met in town. They don't venture far into Whisperwind Haven, nor do they dare set up camp in the wild. They loiter around town before heading back to the city...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "What kind of knight should I be?" I catch myself asking that question from time to time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My choice... I-I don't know... We... Let's keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're gettin' close. What's the matter, {PlayerName}? Run out of gas already?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know. I feel like after leaving Egla Town, the Mad Knight's Echo became... restless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Restless? The knight... Right, maybe it's just following its oath? I remember Cosimo and Carlow both said a true knight would never betray the path of service he swore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean, wouldn't they fight TDs out of instinct? Maybe if we used its power in the right way, it could help us out...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlow has probably made it back to town by now. What are you going to say when you see him...?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He should have had enough time to think things over. Let's go speak to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a boy... Sorry about the ruckus, outlander. Are you checking in? If not, it's getting late. You wouldn't want to be caught out there during the Night Reveries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. You probably noticed the graffiti, statues, and signs all scattered across town, no?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you mentioned it, we did see a bunch of kids running around with wooden swords and bedsheets for capes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, those youngsters are just reenacting the knight's play. The Night Reveries are a kind of a performance, too. They can be traced back to the legend of a brave knight who slayed a giant in Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, the legendary knight has become an irreplaceable symbol of humility, honor, and bravery for the town. The oath the boy just recited is one of the legacies the knight left us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Knights from far and wide would gather here before setting off to the depth of Whisperwind Haven in search of the legend's origin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As more knights filled our streets, an odd one emerged. These days, folks like to call him the "Mad Knight."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He only shows himself after dusk. Folks say he roams the outskirts, hunting down Tacet Discords. Get too close, and you might find yourself on the sharp end of his blade!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how he became the "Mad Knight," the talk of the town. We reckon he's cursed now from wrestling with those wretches for so long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To placate this restless soul, the town created the Night Reveries—endless dramas of the knight enacted by the Echoes. Townsfolk and visitors alike were advised to stay indoors at night.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Could it be a symptom of Overclocking?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... there's one lad who stands apart. Fancies that the knight isn't mad at all. He believes a true knight would never betray their oath, no matter the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For him, every swing of a knight's sword must carry meaning. To prove his theory, the boy is hell-bent on becoming a knight and challenging the Mad Knight to a duel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Carlow. We all thought it was just another childhood fantasy, but he's held onto that dream to this day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Becoming a knight doesn't sound too bad. Hehe, you get all the cool points plus who can resist that suit of armor?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True, but those are knights who have earned their reputations. Maintaining <ano=purity>"knighthood"</ano> is a thing of the past now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cosimo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, look at the time! Apologies for rambling on, traveler. If you need a place to stay, just let me know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aw, don't worry, Abby! Just follow these steps and {PlayerName} will wake up in no time. See?

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi ya, it's been a while. Do you remember me? Or... do you still know where you are?

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right as a nut! That means you're A-okay! Just sit tight and get some more rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, you still remember my name! That means you're A-okay! Just get some more rest and you'll be up and at 'em again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really scared the crap out of me, {PlayerName}! You froze up like Carlow when you touched that thing. Luckily, Margherita came by and snapped you out of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must have touched a Primordia Bloom that hid itself under the Echo. They bring weird hallucinations to anyone who touches them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I touched one when I was little, and a strange knight taught me how to break free from it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, and he wasn't like any knight I've ever seen in the city. He was handing out these knight rings to everyone and asking if they wanted to be a knight and explore the depths of Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But being a knight was never my dream, you know! Since I was a child, I wanted to open a restaurant in the city. Nothing makes me happier than seein' the smiles on my customers' faces!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I told him that, the knight took the ring away and plopped his helmet on my head, sayin', "Maybe you don't need this ring after all."

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... I'd better be off now! I came to Egla Town to find some inspiration for new recipes. Something with a knightly twist, I think...

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm glad I could lend a hand! As for that chipper young lad over there, he's been in it longer than you, so it might take him a wee bit to come around. But don't fret, it's not serious!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Margherita waves goodbye, you both wait patiently for Carlow to wake up from his hallucination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where am I...? I—it's you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were stung by a Primordia Bloom hidden in this Echo and were in hallucination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. That explains why I was seeing... Thank you! You are the outlanders from the inn, right? I'm sorry you had to witness my embarrassment again.

Options.PlotLineKey: You should also thank Ms. Margherita...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the name of Korlacchi, I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Wherever my path may lead, I vow to uphold justice and fairness for all..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... you know these words. That means you've met the knight!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The knight told us he plans to travel further and hopes we can follow his trail to meet him one day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly! He spoke those very words to me. Maybe he's traveling to uphold his family's values of chivalry and recruit new knights!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you also here to look for him? If you seek his trail, you're standing on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be where he made camp. I can see signs he was here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This was just one stop along his quest. Since you've come here to find him, will you join me for the rest of the journey?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlow
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still have more leads we can follow. By the way, we haven't been properly introduced yet, have we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, what about me? You can call me Abby. {PlayerName} here is pretty tough and all, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, I wasn't finished! Wait for me...
